Gage Salzano

Graphic Designer, 1986–?

You're only given a little spark of madness. You mustn't lose it.

— Robin Williams, 1978

This is a sample quote to test the random selection.

— Second Guy, 1922

This is the third sample quote. Looks like the randomness is working.

— Third Guy, 1933

This is the fourth sample quote. Now I'm sure the randomness is working. This one let's make long to test what it looks like when it wraps.

— Fourth Guy, 1944

Available for hire

Hi, my name is Gage Salzano.

I’m a graphic web designer or whatever you want to call it. I help people create brands for new companies and initiatives, conceptualize marketing campaigns, visualize and illustrate things and design websites. My goal is to always provide the best quality stuff I can for a fair price.

I have been lucky enough to have been employed at some cool agencies and studios through the years. I had the opportunity to work directly with a range of clients and learned a ton of things about what it takes to get projects done.

I got obsessed with this stuff when I was in grade school, but didn’t realize there was an occupation called “Graphic Design” until I went to college.

I could make a living doing this stuff?
Not in my wildest dream.

826CHI 2015 Annual Report — Print

Hi, my name is Gage Salzano.

I’m a graphic web designer or whatever you want to call it. I help people create brands for new companies and initiatives, conceptualize marketing campaigns, visualize and illustrate things and design websites. My goal is to always provide the best quality stuff I can for a fair price.

I have been lucky enough to have been employed at some cool agencies and studios through the years. I had the opportunity to work directly with a range of clients and learned a ton of things about what it takes to get projects done.

I got obsessed with this stuff when I was in grade school, but didn’t realize there was an occupation called “Graphic Design” until I went to college.

I could make a living doing this stuff?
Not in my wildest dream.
